intro: Blepharis javanica, commonly known as the Java spurge, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The flowers, which bloom in clusters, are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, attracting insects for pollination.
